channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Morning Joe plays Kash Patel's 'we are coming after you' clip thrice: 'This is bad for Donald Trump'
item.description: ​"Yes, we’re going to come after the people in the media who lied about American citizens, who helped Joe Biden rig presidential elections," Patel said in that 2023 interview with Steve Bannon. “We’re going to come after you. Whether it’s criminally or civilly, we’ll figure that out. But yeah, we’re putting you all on notice," he said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nate Silver enraged over Biden pardoning son: 'Don't vote for any Democrat in 2028 who...'
item.description: Nate Silver expressed frustration after President Joe Biden's surprising pardon of his son Hunter Biden, who was convicted of illegal gun possession, lying about addiction, and tax evasion. Silver criticized the White House for misleading post-election assurances and urged Democrats to repudiate the pardon. "Don't vote for any Democrat in 2028 who doesn't repudiate the pardon within 48 hours," Nate Silver posted
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I don’t want to go to heaven': Ohio girl pleads with father not to kill her during standoff with cops in chilling audio
item.description: A distressing audio of seven-year-old Oaklynn Alexander pleading with her father during a police standoff in Ohio has gone viral. Her non-custodial father, Charles Ryan Alexander, kidnapped her, leading to a tense situation where he threatened both their lives. Police intervened, resulting in his death but Oaklynn's safe recovery.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Belgium loses case against women taken from mothers in colonial era
item.description: The Belgian state was ordered to compensate five mixed-race women who were forcibly placed in an orphanage 70 years ago under a colonial-era practice. The court deemed the abductions a crime against humanity. This ruling marks a historic first for colonial-era reparation cases.

item.title: Who is Hallie Olivere who found brother-in-law and ex Hunter Biden's gun in 2018?
item.description: In October 2018, Hallie Biden found a gun in Hunter Biden's truck. She panicked and discarded the gun in a trash can near a grocery store that had CCTV cameras. Police found the gun and it was traced back to Hunter Biden. Hallie and Hunter were in a relationship at that time as both of them were coping with Beau Biden's death. Hallie said Hunter introduced her to drugs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Vivek Ramaswamy predicted Joe Biden would pardon son Hunter
item.description: In June, when Hunter Biden was convicted, Vivek Ramaswamy predicted that it was a farce and Joe Biden would definitely pardon him. At that time, Biden did not indicate that he would favor his son and save him from trial and following punishment. But on Sunday, in a surprising move, Biden pardoned his son Sunday saying that his son was treated differently as his political opponents pounced on him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh halves power imports from Adani after outstanding dues: Report
item.description: Bangladesh has halved its power imports from Adani Power due to reduced winter demand and disputes over $650 million in unpaid dues. Adani had already reduced supply after delayed payments, escalating the outstanding dues to $900 million. Power pricing differences and anti-India sentiment compound the issue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Joe Biden pardoning his son Hunter is so controversial
item.description: President Joe Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter Biden, has led to significant controversy. It contradicts Biden's previous assurances against such a pardon, diverges from Justice Department clemency guidelines, raises ethical concerns regarding nepotism, and has sparked political backlash and renewed scrutiny of Biden's clemency record.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canada pulls refugee welcome mat, launches ads warning asylum claims hard
item.description: Canada, once a welcoming nation for refugees, is now cautioning asylum-seekers through a $250,000 global online ad campaign that making a claim is difficult and has strict guidelines.

item.title: Fall of Aleppo: Who are Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, jihadist group behind resurgence of Syria conflict?
item.description: Recently, Syrian rebels launched a major offensive in Aleppo, seizing parts of the city and pushing south towards Hama. This prompted the first Russian airstrikes on Aleppo since 2016. The operation was led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), reviving conflict amidst new geopolitical dynamics and challenges faced by Assad's allies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Landmark climate change case opens at top UN court as island nations fear rising seas
item.description: The top UN court has commenced hearings on the legal responsibilities of countries to combat climate change and assist vulnerable nations. The case, pushed by island nations facing rising sea levels, seeks to establish international legal obligations and consequences for actions affecting the climate, with input from 99 countries and various organizations.

item.title: Mystery of repeating radio waves solved, scientists trace origin of slow radio pulses
item.description: Astronomers have pinpointed the source of slow, repeating radio bursts from space to a red dwarf star likely orbiting a white dwarf. These unusual signals, discovered in 2022, challenge existing theories about how pulsars emit radio waves and stem from interactions between the red dwarf's stellar wind and the white dwarf's magnetic field.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You guys are f**king crazy': Woman insults Indian-American family, caught on camera
item.description: A woman was captured on video being racist towards Pervez Taufiq and his Indian American family during a United Airlines transfer bus ride in Los Angeles. The incident followed her alleged harassment of Taufiq’s son during their flight. United Airlines staff intervened after bystanders confirmed her as the aggressor, leading to her removal from the bus.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hunter vows to make 'amends and rebuild lives' after father Joe Biden pardons him
item.description: Hunter Biden, after receiving a presidential pardon from his father Joe Biden, expressed remorse for past mistakes during his addiction struggles. Highlighting his five-year sobriety, he committed to helping others with addiction. The pardon, defended by President Biden, sparked varied reactions amidst political accusations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Trump's 'Health Czar' RFK Jr seen working out at gym for 'confirmation hearing', netizens react
item.description: US President-elect Donald Trump's appointment of Robert F Kennedy Jr to lead the Department of Health and Human Services has generated significant attention. Kennedy's plans include tackling chronic diseases, reducing corporate influence, and reforming the FDA. Known for his controversial views on vaccines, his nomination promises substantial changes in US health policies and practices.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'What worked in Wisconsin can work nationwide': Ben Wikler joins DNC chair race after 2024 defeat
item.description: Wisconsin Democratic Party Chair Ben Wikler announced his candidacy for DNC chair to guide the party following the 2024 election victory by Republicans and Donald Trump. Wikler emphasizes year-round organization in various regions, citing successes in Wisconsin such as flipping the state Supreme Court majority and re-electing Governor Tony Evers, aiming to replicate these achievements nationally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia protest enters fourth night of clash after suspension of EU talks: What we know so far
item.description: Protests in Georgia continue for a fourth night, sparked by the suspension of EU membership talks, leading to confrontations between police and demonstrators across the country. Critics allege the government is leaning towards authoritarianism and closer ties with Russia. The unrest has resulted in injuries and hospitalizations among protesters, police, and a media worker.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Who stole his phone?': Bernie Sanders backs Trump's DOGE initiative, Elon Musk, netizens react
item.description: Senator Bernie Sanders endorsed President-elect Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) initiative targeting Pentagon spending. He expressed concern over the Pentagon's $886 billion budget and audit failures. Sanders emphasized the necessity for change in federal and defense spending, highlighting that only 13 senators opposed the defense budget last year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hitman offered $71,000 to kill Canadian reporter who was covering his trial, admits to plot
item.description: A hitman, Frédérick Silva, convicted of multiple murders, admits to offering C$100,000 to kill Montreal crime reporter Daniel Renaud. The plot remained active for two months but was not executed. Quebec Premier François Legault denounced the plot, emphasizing continued police action against organized crime.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince William was jealous of Harry before his wedding: Report
item.description: Prince Harry revealed his brother, Prince William, was envious of his beard during Harry's wedding to Meghan. Despite military protocol, Harry received permission from the Queen to keep his beard, sparking a week-long quarrel between the brothers. The rule has since been amended, and William now sports a beard with approval.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
